intro: Hedypnois biennis, commonly known as the annual senna, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with palmately compound leaves and bright yellow flowers. Its seeds are enclosed in slender, cylindrical pods that split open when mature. Hedypnois biennis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of fodder for livestock.
